data.title: The Antigua Forum
data.meta_description: Success Stories Our participants have come from 73 countries. Learn more about them through the interactive map or use the list below. Loading…
data.text:
Who Comes?

Our participants have come from 73 countries. Learn more about them through the interactive map or use the list below.

Loading...

Agatti Lima,

Edson

Brazil and United States

Director of strategy at UNICEPLAC, a for-profit higher education institution in Brazil; former tax adviser at KPMG in Budapest; co-founder of Eagles for Liberty, a market-liberal student organization at Florida Gulf Coast University; developing Hayek Global College

Aguirre,

Esperanza

Spain

Former minister of education and culture; former president of the Senate; former president of the Community of Madrid; president of the Popular Party of Madrid

Video interview

Aldana,

Juan Fernando

Guatemala

Manager, corporate investment at Inversiones Centroamericanas, S.A.; former associate director of corporate finance at SABMiller in London; former associate at Deutsche Bank; professor of economics and monetary and fiscal policy at UFM

Allman,

David

United States

Owner and chairman of Regent Partners, a real estate company with more than $2.5 billion in assets; chairman of numerous philanthropic initiatives, including Opportunity International Nicaragua, which fights poverty through business training and economic development projects

Alt,

Robert

United States

President, chief executive officer, and trustee of Buckeye Institute, a free-market public policy think tank; legal scholar with expertise in criminal justice, national security, and constitutional law; former director of Heritage Foundation’s Center for Legal and Judicial Studies

Altmaier,

Paulette

United States

Board member of Learning Equality, an ed-tech nonprofit; board member of Concord Consortium; former executive at Cisco, Dell, and Juniper Networks; adviser and mentor focused on education and the preservation of classical-liberal principles

Alvarez,

David

Puerto Rico

Executive director of the Puerto Rico Public-Private Partnerships Authority; former senior adviser to the chairman and president of the Government Development Bank of Puerto Rico

Amez-Droz,

Elise

United States

Program associate at Mercatus Center at George Mason University, leading Open Health program to foster and disseminate innovative health-policy research; former analyst in the pharmaceutical industry; former manager with Duke Interdisciplinary Social Innovators, a nonprofit consultancy

Antillón,

Federico

Guatemala and United States

Pediatrician and cellular biologist; medical director at National Pediatric Oncology Unit (UNOP); board member, UFM School of Medicine; fellowship director of joint program between UNOP and UFM; author of more than seventy medical articles and book chapters

Aragón,

Luis

Guatemala

Physician, entrepreneur, and professor; founder of Médicos en Libertad (doctors in freedom), a multidisciplinary group committed to improving the health system in Guatemala; professor and clinical coordinator at the School of Medicine at UFM

Arellano,

Soledad

Chile

Undersecretary for the Ministry of Social Planning; former economic minister responsible for advising Chilean antitrust authority

Arewa,

Olufunmilayo

United States and Nigeria

Professor at Temple University Beasley School of Law; consultant on projects related to education and scientific and technological capacity in Africa; worked on copyright reform in Nigeria; author of forthcoming books on African American music and technology disruption in Africa

Arosemena,

Pablo

Ecuador

Entrepreneur and president of restaurant chain Subway Ecuador; president of the chamber of commerce in Guayaquil; president of Inteligencia Estratégica, a firm specializing in the economic impact of public policies; former president of Fundación Ecuador Libre, a market-liberal think tank

Arria,

Diego

Venezuela

Former president of the United Nations Security Council; former permanent representative of Venezuela to the UN; member of Advisory Council of International Crisis Group; former governor of Caracas; filed charges against Hugo Chávez at the ICC for crimes against humanity

Arunga,

June

Kenya

CEO of Usafi Comfort, a wastewater management solutions provider; partner at Black Star Line, a technology provider for mobile payments; advocate for property rights in Africa; one of Forbes’ 20 Youngest Power Women in Africa 2011 and Fast Company’s 100 Most Creative People in Business 2010

Video interview

Aslam,

Azhar

Pakistan and United Kingdom

Founder and chairman of Istanbul Network for Liberty, which promotes market-liberal policies in the Muslim world; founder and executive director of Vision 21, which promotes literacy and liberty-related values and policies in Pakistan; plastic surgeon with practice in London

Avishai,

Elisheva

United States and Canada

Strategist, teacher, and nonprofit leader; co-director of Mill Institute at University of Austin; founder of the I-Think Initiative at Rotman School of Management in Toronto

Bader,

Lawson

United States

President and CEO of DonorsTrust, a foundation serving libertarian and conservative philanthropists; former president of Competitive Enterprise Institute; former vice president of Mercatus Center; board member of Atlas Network and State Policy Network; president of Antigua Forum 2019

Bader,

Cynthia

United States

President of CEB Teaching and Learning, developing educational projects with viewpoint diversity and intellectual rigor; former elementary school teacher at National Cathedral School in Washington, DC; former professional development instructor at Bill of Rights Institute, leading popular projects on US history and civics

Baehr,

Evan

United States

Founder and CEO of Teneo, a leadership network that develops practical solutions to pressing issues; serial founder of tech companies, venture investor, and adviser; best-selling author of Get Backed, a guide to launching a company; professor at University of Texas

Baehr,

James

United States

Constitutional litigator with the Pelican Institute for Public Policy and a founder of the Pelican Center for Justice, a public-interest law firm; former special assistant to the president in the White House Domestic Policy Council; attorney and officer in the US Marine Corps Reserves

Bailey,

Cody Marx

Mexico and United States

Quietly working on projects in the blockchain ecosystem that help to bring the promises of decentralization to the masses; managing partner of XRAM Capital, a cryptoasset investment firm; cofounder and chief technology officer of Smart Kx

Baker,

Steve

United Kingdom

Conservative Party MP for Wycombe; former aerospace engineer with Royal Air Force; former software engineer; co-founder of Cobden Center, a market-liberal think tank focusing on monetary policy.

Video interview

Balcerowicz,

Leszek

Poland

Former head of the central bank; architect of post-Soviet economic reforms.

• Video interview

Baptista Leite,

Ricardo

Portugal and Canada

Co-founder of Estoril Conferences, which focus on globalization issues; medical doctor; member of Portuguese parliament, serving on health and foreign affairs committees; head of public health at the Institute of Health Sciences at Catholic University of Portugal; Cascais city councilor

Barbee,

Scott

United States

Owner and president of Aegis Financial Corporation, an award-winning wealth management firm; director of the Donald and Paula Smith Family Foundation, which organizes political debates and supports organizations such as Cato Institute, Atlas Network, and Manhattan Institute

Bare,

John

United States

Member of the leadership team at John Templeton Foundation and head of programs focused on human sciences, character development, and individual freedom and free markets; former senior vice president at Arthur M. Blank Family Foundation; former disruptor-in-residence at Babson College

Barrows,

Stephen

United States

Chief operating officer at Acton Institute; former executive vice president, provost, and dean of faculty at Aquinas College; former officer in US Air Force and professor of economics at US Air Force Academy

Beacom,

Nathan

United States

Founder and executive director of Lyceum Movement, a project to build meaningful communities by providing space for neighbors to learn from each other; former freelance writer and policy analyst

Belghazi,

Mouatassim

Morocco

Founder and CEO of FONDEP Microcredit (Albaraka), a leader in financial services for small businesses; chairman of Saraya Holdings, which has interests in agribusiness, distribution, real estate, and tourism; former CEO of SOMED Group and ONA-SNI Group, Morocco’s first private financial and industrial holding

Bell,

Tom W.

United States

Professor at Chapman University School of Law; legal adviser to Elevator Cities Development Corporation, which promotes and designs startup cities; author of Intellectual Privilege: Copyright, Common Law, and the Common Good

Bendukidze,

Kakha (1956 -2017)

Georgia

Former minister of economy; former state minister on reforms; architect of economic liberalization during the Rose Revolution

Bernstein,

Sheldon

United States and Guatemala

Chief strategy officer at Blue Ocean IQ, offering strategic advice and coaching to businesses in Central America; former executive at Google, responsible for customer acquisition, strategy, and operations; executive board member of Aly.ai, Nukunem, and Thurgood Studios, and strategy advisor at El Cubo Center

Besa,

Jaime

Chile

Investment manager at Drake Capital; former adviser to the Ministry of Social Planning; co-founder of MBAChile.com, a worldwide collaboration of MBA graduates and students

Betters,

Ryan

United States and Haiti

Executive director of Copenhagen Consensus Center, a think tank that uses cost-benefit analysis to develop smart solutions for the world’s biggest problems; decorated US Marine Corps combat veteran; former food industry entrepreneur; former USAID business development consultant

Bleazard,

Emily

United States

Communications strategist, digital marketer, and content creator; chief digital officer at Iron Light; former director of digital marketing for Texas Public Policy Foundation

Blousson,

Gonzalo

Argentina

Businessman; founder and president of Partido Liberal Libertario, Argentina’s libertarian party.

• Video interview

Blumenthal,

Jesse

United States

Head of technology and innovation policy at Charles Koch Institute and Charles Koch Foundation, which work to foster a national conversation on critical issues that have an impact on the advancement of societal well-being; former director of client strategy at the digital media firm Engage

Bookman,

Zac

United States

Co-founder and CEO of OpenGov Inc.; principal at Formation 8 Partners; former special advisor to General HR McMaster, commander of Anticorruption Task Force in Kabul Afghanistan.

• Video interview

Borders,

Max

United States

Author of The Social Singularity: A Decentralist Manifesto; founder and executive director of Social Evolution, a nonprofit dedicated to solving social problems through innovation; former editor at Foundation for Economic Education (FEE); futurist, speaker, and author.

Boteo,

Paul

Guatemala

Executive director of Fundación Libertad y Desarrollo, an independent and private think tank dedicated to the study of social, economic, and political issues to advance the principles of a free society; university professor and a regular guest in local media for the economic and social analysis of Guatemalan affairs

Boudreaux,

Karol

United States and Ethiopia

Land tenure and resource rights specialist at the Cloudburst Group; former Africa land tenure specialist at USAID; former member of the property rights working group for UN Commission on Legal Empowerment of the Poor

Bowman,

Sam

United Kingdom and Ireland

Economist and executive director of Adam Smith Institute, one of Britain’s leading market-liberal think tanks; frequent commentator and writer for the Wall Street Journal, BBC, and the Guardian

Boyack,

Connor

United States

Founder and president of Libertas Institute, a public policy think tank in Utah; author of the Tuttle Twins children’s book series, which teaches kids of all ages the principles of liberty; policy reformer and regular media commentator

Video interview

Boyd,

Karen

United States

Strategic and financial consultant to early-stage and established companies; board member of several community associations; former president of a nonprofit specializing in educational innovation in developing countries

Boyd,

Robert

United Kingdom

Managing trustee at Institute of Economic Affairs; trustee at Network for a Free Society; member of Atlas Network’s advisory council; founding member of Atlas Network’s board of directors; former CEO of a multinational investment firm

Bradbury,

James

United States

Private practice attorney focusing on environmental issues, water policy, business law, eminent domain, and regulatory and legislative matters; adjunct professor of law at Texas A&M University School of Law; policy adviser to elected officials on environmental and natural resource issues

Braly,

Angela

United States

Former CEO of Wellpoint, Inc. (now Anthem); president of Braly Group; co-founder of Policy Circle, an organization of professional women who meet to discuss economics and policy; member of the board of directors of Brookfield Asset Management, ExxonMobil, Lowe’s, Procter & Gamble

Brien,

Stephen

United Kingdom

Senior fellow at Future Africa Forum; former policy director at Legatum Institute; chair of UK Social Security Advisory Committee; advised governments in the Middle East and sub-Saharan Africa

Brimen,

Erick

United States and Honduras

CEO of NeWay Capital and its subsidiary Honduras Próspera, investment firms working with governments and local leaders to enable development in free economic zones; entrepreneur with a background in investment banking; former CFO of Latin American operations for Borealis Group

Brito,

Jerry

United States

Executive director of Coin Center, a new nonprofit research and advocacy center focused on public policy issues facing cryptocurrency technologies such as Bitcoin; adjunct professor of law and former director of the Technology Policy Program at Mercatus Center at George Mason University.

Video interview

Brooks,

Greg

United States

Co-founder of Better Cities Project, which advances market-oriented policy solutions to urban challenges; former principal at West Third Group, a marketing and public affairs firm in policy and advocacy communications; former public affairs director with Reason Foundation and Goldwater Institute

Brown,

Montgomery

United States

Program director at Earhart Foundation

Bullard,

Alfredo

Peru

Practicing lawyer with specialty in arbitration, mediation and antitrust issues; law professor; former head of national antitrust authority (Indecopi)

Bunge,

Thomas

Guatemala

Pediatrician; founding partner of Pediatric Clinical Center; panel physician for US Embassy in Guatemala; designated medical practitioner of Health Management Branch, Citizenship and Immigration, Canada; UFM trustee.

Bydalek,

Grace

United States

Manager of Dissident Project, a venture of Young Voices to educate students about socialism; performer and writer with appearances on HBO and Netflix, and experience writing for political candidates and magazines

Caceres,

Zach

United States and Guatemala

Former executive director of the Michael Polanyi College, a school of creative development, as well as the Startup Cities Institute, a research center studying startup communities that innovate in law and policy; former editor of Radical Social Entrepreneurs, an online magazine that promotes innovation in education and governance

Cachanosky,

Iván

Argentina

Chief economist and researcher at Fundación Libertad y Progreso, a think tank that investigates, develops, and promotes public policy initiatives; team member at Corporate Training Group, Inc.; columnist, economic analyst, and consultant.

Calabrese,

Denis

United States

Political, policy, and business strategist with expertise in crisis communications, litigation support, media relations; co-founder and chief strategist at Texans for Lawsuit Reform, the most successful state-based civil justice reform group in the country; former president of Laura and John Arnold Foundation

Video interview

Calzada,

Gabriel

Spain

President of Universidad Hesperides in the Canary Islands; former president of Universidad Francisco Marroquín; president of Mont Pelerin

Society and board member of Rising Tide Foundation; founding president of Juan de Mariana Institute in Spain, a libertarian think tank

Capella,

Francisco

Spain

Founding member of Instituto Juan de Mariana, one of Spain’s leading market-liberal think tanks; founding member and professor at OMMA, which offers advanced degrees in economics and finance online; former consultant to US and European industry and governments

Čekerevac,

Petar

Republic of Serbia and United States

Director of project on decentralizing technologies at Atlas Network, focused on bringing technology expertise to policy debates; executive manager of Libertarian Club Libek in Belgrade; cofounder of Talas, a media platform in Serbia; entrepreneur in social media platforms

Chafuen,

Alex

United States and Argentina

President of Atlas Network, one of the world’s largest market-liberal organizations; president of Hispanic American Center for Economic Research; trustee of Grove City College; serves on the boards of Acton Institute and Chase Foundation of the Commonwealth of Virginia; author of Faith and Liberty; Forbes columnist

Chait,

Arthur

United States

Founder of semiconductor firm EoPlex; former division president at Stanford Research Institute; instructor at Stanford University, adjunct professor at Notre Dame, and Menlo College; mentor at Stanford’s accelerator program and Draper University’s bootcamp; visiting professor at UFM and president of Antigua Forum 2016

Chamlee-Wright,

Emily

United States

President and CEO of Institute for Humane Studies, which supports scholars working in the classical liberal tradition; board member and senior scholar at Mercatus Center at George Mason University; former provost and dean at Washington College; lecturer, public speaker, and author.

Chatfield,

Robert

United States

President and CEO of Free to Choose Network, a global media organization that uses media to build support for personal, economic, and political freedom; former CFO of Fluid Imaging Technologies, a manufacturer of scientific instruments; former merger and acquisition adviser to private firms

Chilson,

Neil

United States

Senior research fellow for technology and innovation at Charles Koch Institute; former acting chief technologist at US Federal Trade Commission; former attorney adviser to FTC commissioner Maureen K. Ohlhausen; computer scientist, lawyer, and technology policy expert.

Chisholm,

John

United States

Technology entrepreneur and investor; CEO of John Chisholm Ventures; founder and former CEO of Decisive Technology (now part of Google) and CustomerSat (now part of FocusVision); past president and chair of worldwide MIT Alumni Association; trustee of MIT and Santa Fe Institute

• Video interview

Choden,

Karma

Bhutan

Program coordinator at QED Consulting Group, a firm that advises major international organizations and governments; former program officer at the Bhutanese Chamber of Commerce and Industry; former program officer for the king of Bhutan

Clavijo,

Julio

Ecuador

Adviser to the head of the CREO political party, the second largest in the country’s legislature; international executive board member and former Latin American chairman of Students for Liberty

Coates,

Ken S.

Canada

Co-director of Aboriginal People and Natural Resources program at Macdonald-Laurier Institute; Canada Research Chair in Regional Innovation at University of Saskatchewan; consultant to indigenous groups, governments and think tanks in Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and for United Nations

Conko,

Carrie

United States

Senior vice president of State Policy Network; former senior vice president at Mercatus Center at George Mason University; expert in strategic guidance and communications

Contreras,

Isabel

Guatemala

Director of Disruptive Education Center at Universidad Francisco Marroquin, leading development of education projects designed to disrupt the traditional K-12 education system; previously served as international partnerships and administrative coordinator at UFM

Costa,

Diogo

Brazil and United Kingdom

Executive director of Institute for Innovation and Governance, a market-liberal foundation in Brazil; advisory board member at Students for Liberty; researcher affiliated with Cato Institute and Atlas Network; taught political economy at King’s College London

Costa,

Mickey

United States

Co-founder and CEO of FundElevator.com, a crowd-sourcing platform to support causes and politicians

Cranberg,

Alex

United States

Founder of Alliance for Choice in Education; member of University of Texas System Board of Regents; founder and chairman of Aspect Energy

Crowley,

Brian Lee

Canada

Managing director of Macdonald-Laurier Institute; founding president of Atlantic Institute for Market Studies; member of Alberta Premier’s Advisory Council on Health; expert on Canadian health care reform

Daboub,

Juan José

El Salvador

Former managing director of the World Bank; former finance minister and architect of privatizations and dollarization in El Salvador; founding CEO of the Global Adaptation Institute; chairman and CEO of the Daboub Partnership

Dalio,

Matt

United States and Guatemala

Founder of China Care Foundation, which provides medical, social, and educational programs for orphans with disabilities in China; founder and CEO of Endless Mobile, a computer platform aimed at the developing world and built with technology at a fraction of the cost of traditional PCs.

• Video interview

Dauphin,

Steven

United States, Mexico and Canada

Founding partner of Bonaventure Capital, which invests in underserved capital markets in the US and abroad; director of Kirchner Impact Foundation, which developed an experimental model to invest equity in historically unservable regions, including in the US, Mexico, and Nigeria

Davidovich,

Marianna

United States and Ukraine

Education entrepreneur, business strategist, and chief external affairs officer at Foundation for Economic Education; previously responsible for curriculum development in character and values programs at FEE; former Russian language linguist with US Air Force

Davidson,

Todd

United States

Senior director of strategic development and director of policy leadership development at State Policy Network, a nonprofit that cultivates free-market, state-based movements rooted in economic and political freedom; former fiscal policy analyst at Kansas Policy Institute

De Gance,

Jon Paul

United States

Executive vice president of Philanthropy Roundtable, where he runs Philanthropy Labs and is co-founder of the Culture of Freedom Initiative; former vice president of external affairs at Americans for Prosperity and Americans for Prosperity Foundation

de Tezanos,

Matías

Guatemala and United States

Internet entrepreneur and investor; named a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum; founder of Hoteles.com, the most visited hotel reservation site in Spanish (acquired by Expedia); founding CEO and chairman of PeopleFund, which invests in tech startups

Delgado,

Gabriel

Guatemala and Honduras

Entrepreneur and co-founder of several companies operating in Latin America that focus on technology services and computer security for telecommunications, industry, and commerce; chief development officer at Honduras Próspera; partner at NeWay Capital; member of UFM Board of Trustees

Demeester,

Tuur

Belgium

Financial analyst and frequent media commentator on digital currencies; early investor and advocate of Bitcoin; owner of AdamantResearch, a financial research firm; former editor of MacroTrends, a financial newsletter.

• Video interview

Deming,

John

United States and New Zealand

Angel investor and entrepreneur specializing in medical access technology, health-care technology, and innovative models for linking entrepreneurs and investors; seed investor in firms and technologies that challenge harmful government regulations and inefficient business structures

Dennis,

Kimberly

United States

President and CEO of Searle Freedom Trust, a grantmaking foundation that supports public policy research; first executive director and former board member of Philanthropy Roundtable; co-founder and chairman of the board of DonorsTrust; former board member of George Mason University.

DeVos,

Brad

United States

Chief operating officer of Independent Institute; former program director at American Institute for Economic Research (AIER) and president and CEO of Bastiat Society, a business outreach program; worked as an engineer for nine years and owned a consulting company

Diaz,

Hugo

Guatemala and United States

Serial entrepreneur in interactive learning and health care technology; co-founder of TeamLogiQ, an interactive learning firm; co-founder of Vital Interaction, a patient engagement company for medical services providers; director of Acton MBA program at UFM

Díaz Cuervo,

Jorge Carlos

Mexico

President of Universidad de La Libertad in Mexico; former director of Kybernus, a nonprofit formed by Grupo Salina to create social value; previously served in Mexico’s federal government as director general of regional development; served as president of Mexico’s Social Democratic Party; member of the board of trustees of Soutwestern University.

Díaz Lupian,

Ebal Jair

Honduras

Legislative director of Honduran congress, responsible for advancing legislation on critical issues; key leader of efforts to establish autonomous development zones in Honduras

DiFiglia,

Joseph

United States

Director of education outreach at izzit.org, a teaching resource website; founder and executive director of New Jersey Council for Economic Education; founder of VoEx, an NFT marketplace

Dogar,

Andreea

United Kingdom

Senior research associate at University of Buckingham, developing teacher training program for low-cost private schools in India and Nigeria; teacher and education consultant with experience developing training programs in Asia, Africa, and Central Europe

Donaire,

Susana

Mexico

Coordinator of institutional development at México Evalúa, a think tank that evaluates and monitors public policy outcomes to improve efficiency and quality; Smith Fellow at Atlas Network; expert in fundraising, monitoring and evaluation systems, and institutional strengthening.

Dourado,

Eli

United States

Senior research fellow at Center for Growth and Opportunity at Utah State University; former head of global policy and communications at aviation startup Boom Supersonic; former senior research fellow at Mercatus Center at George Mason University and director of its technology policy program

Dowell,

Will

United States

Managing director at Stand Together Foundation, a philanthropic community supporting bottom-up solutions to empower people facing barriers in communities; vice chairman of the board of Behind Every Door, an organization providing services to improve life in underserved neighborhoods

Dufort,

Daniel

Canada

President and CEO of Montreal Economic Institute, a Canadian free-market think tank; worked in federal politics as speech writer, issues manager, and advisor; worked in major public relations firms

Durana,

Richard

Slovakia

Co-founder and director of Institute of Economic and Social Studies (INESS), Slovakia’s leading market-liberal think tank; former research scientist at Institute of Chemistry at Slovak Academy of Sciences

Dyer,

Don

United States

Founder and CEO of Professional Janitorial Services, a commercial cleaning firm; former founding chairman of the board of Regents School of Austin, a private school with classical Christian education; board member of CORE Fellowship, a sponsor of the National Prayer Breakfast and outreach to political leaders

Video interview

Ealy,

Lenore T.

United States

Senior fellow for communities at Charles Koch Institute, working on strategy and research priorities; founding president of the Philanthropic Enterprise; founder of Thinkitecture, Inc., a boutique consultancy for social entrepreneurs, nonprofit executives, and donors; executive director of the Philadelphia Society

Video interview

El Harmouzi,

Nouh

Morocco and Egypt

Director of the Arab Center for Scientific Research and Humane Studies; editor of news website MinbarAlHurriyya.org; professor of economics at Ibn Toufail University in Morocco; recognized for his speech calling for economic freedom in Egypt’s Tahrir Square during the Arab Spring

• Video interview

Espada,

Joao Carlos

Portugal

Professor of political studies and director of the Institute for Political Studies at the Catholic University of Portugal; former adviser to two presidents of Portugal; awarded the Order of Merit by the Portuguese government and the highest civil recognition given by the Polish Ministry of Foreign Affairs

Video interview

Evans,

Richard

United States and India

Senior research fellow and director of open policy at Center for Growth and Opportunity, leading a 50-state microsimulation of policy; core maintainer of the OG-USA open source; director of the Open Source Economics Laboratory

FAN,

Gang

China

Secretary general of China Reform Foundation; former member of the Monetary Policy Committee of China’s central bank; economic professor and director of the National Economic Research Institute; a Foreign Policy Top 100 Global Thinker.

• Video interview

Farquharson,

Tracey

The Bahamas

Senior program officer at Templeton World Charity Foundation, overseeing annual planning of strategic initiatives and grant development; leads the development of local initiatives in The Bahamas; twenty years of experience in teaching and teacher training

Fedorowich,

Richard

United States

Managing partner at J. Locke & Company, a boutique merchant bank; former executive at several growth-stage companies; led over 100 buy side and 50 sell side public and private transactions totaling over US$10 billion; investment and business strategist, corporate value maximizer

Fernández-Lasquetty,

Javier

Spain

UFM vice president; former minister of health for Community of Madrid; former deputy chief of staff for president José María Aznar; former chief of staff in Spanish Ministry of Education; former secretary general of FAES (Foundation for Social Studies and Analysis), the country’s leading market-liberal think tank.

• Video interview

Figar,

Lucía

Spain

Education reformer; head of Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports for Madrid; former head of Madrid’s immigration agency; former secretary at Ministry of Social Affairs; member of national board for Partido Popular

Files,

Burke

United States and Ireland

President of Financial Examinations and Evaluations, specializing in due diligence, financial and fraud investigations, and asset recovery; president of American Anti-Corruption Institute; founding professor at Hayek Global College; expert on fraud, finance, and intellectual property

Flores,

Ronald

Guatemala

Director of Michael Polanyi College and Department of Education at UFM; author of numerous novels, essays, and short stories, including Last Silence, Signs of Fire, Conjectures of Hoax, The Native Informant, and The Zendale Rebellion

Foretia,

Denis

Cameroon and United States

Co-chair of the Denis & Lenora Foretia Foundation; executive chairman of the Nkafu Policy Institute, a leading Cameroonian think tank; surgeon and president of Association of Cameroonian Physicians in the Americas; surgeon with the University of Tennessee Health Science Center

Frazier,

Mark

United States

President of Openworld, a US-based nonprofit specializing in land value appreciation as a means of privately funding public goods; developer of market-oriented initiatives for private and public sector clients in fifty-six countries

Frezza,

Bill

United States

Consigliere at Boston Microfluidics, an innovative lab testing company; former host of syndicated talk show RealClear Radio Hour; former tech entrepreneur and venture capitalist; Competitive Enterprise Institute fellow; author of 2015 Antigua Forum case study on New Zealand’s market-based reforms

• Video interview

Ganley,

Declan

Ireland and United States

Chairman and CEO of Rivada Networks, a telecommunications firm that specializes in arbitrage and use of radio spectrum; founder and chairman of the pan-European political party Libertas

• Video interview

García de la Granja,

Pilar

Spain

Award-winning journalist; US bureau chief correspondent for Telecinco TV of Spain; US correspondent for Diario el Economista; first Spanish-speaking journalist to transmit live from the NYSE; winner of 2007 Golden Antenna award for economics broadcasting in Spain.

• Video interview

Gebel,

Titus

Germany

Co-founder and former CEO of Deutsche Rohstoff, a German investment company with interests in mining and oil production; former asset manager; founder of Free Private Cities Limited, a for-profit venture designed to offer the basic services of government in voluntary arrangements

Geddes,

Rick

United States and Costa Rica

Expert on public-private partnerships and other innovations to improve financing of transportation, water, and infrastructure projects; professor and director of the Program in Infrastructure Policy at Cornell University; former senior economist on the White House Council of Economic Advisers

Gharred,

Mohamed

Tunisia and Canada

Adviser on bilateral relations between Tunisia and Canada; member of international office of Center for Strategic and Diplomatic Studies; activist and former strategic adviser for elections in Saint Laurent with Liberal Party of Canada

Ghersi,

Lucas

Peru

Lawyer at Estudio Ghersi; professor of constitutional law and economic analysis at various universities; former adviser at the Constitutional Court in Peru; prominent opponent of recent efforts to revise Peru’s constitution; adviser to civil society groups opposed to the abuse of executive power during the Covid-19 pandemic

Gibson,

Michael

United States

Co-founder and general partner at 1517 Fund, which invests in young innovators and entrepreneurs; venture capitalist; principal at Thiel Capital; vice president for grants at Thiel Foundation, where he helps run the 20 Under 20 Thiel Fellowship

Given,

Casey

United States

Executive director of Young Voices, a nonprofit that trains early-career market-liberal journalists and analysts and connects them with media outlets around the world; former director of communications at Students for Liberty; political columnist at news website Rare

Glasgall,

Bill

United States

Director of state and local program at Volcker Alliance, which helps bring transparency and best practices into state-level budgeting; award-winning journalist; former Bloomberg News managing editor; former senior editor and writer at Businessweek

Glustrom,

Eric

United States

Founder and CEO of Watson Institute, an innovative education program for entrepreneurs that combines seminars, project development, and mentorship; founder of Educate!, which educates future leaders in Uganda, Rwanda, and Kenya; named twice to Forbes 30 Social Entrepreneurs Under 30

Video interview

González,

José Raúl

Guatemala

Chief executive officer of Grupo Progreso, a regional leader in the building materials sector; professor of finance and economics and former dean of UFM School of Economic Sciences; member of the UFM Board of Trustees; former president of CIEN, a think tank in Guatemala

Gonzalez,

Francisco

United States and Guatemala

Writer, podcaster and fundraiser; founder and CEO at Fearless Journeys, a collaborative community; host of Agents of Innovation podcast; former director of philanthropy at National Review Institute; former vice president for advancement at James Madison Institute; visiting professor at UFM

Granier,

Marcel
